Module com.fakeco.inventorysys
Package com.fakeco.inventorysys

Class MainScreenController

java.lang.Object
com.fakeco.inventorysys.MainScreenController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MainScreenController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This is the controller for the primary application menu.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      @Deprecated public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Deprecated.
      This function sets up the initial values. It brings in all the parts and products in the system and associates their attributes to columns on the tables. It also uses Platform.runlater to reset a listener on the window that is changed in other menus.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • setListener

      public void setListener()
      This function sets a listener on a WindowsEvent. This listener is set on the current stage to gather close requests, which comes from the x in the top right corner. Since this action is modified in other parts of the program, this function ensures that the original functionality of closing the window occurs when anyone clicks on the x in the top right corner. This had to be run after the screen is loaded and so it relies on Platform.runlater.

    • showAlert

      public void showAlert(String alertText)
      This method shows an alert based on the passed string text.
      Parameters:
      alertText - The text for the alert.

    • confirmationAlert

      public boolean confirmationAlert(String alertText)
      This method shows a confirmation alert based on the passed string text.
      Parameters:
      alertText - The text for the alert.
      Returns:
      whether the action is confirmed

    • searchByPart

      public void searchByPart(javafx.event.Event event)
      This function allows the user to search for a Part and return the found values in the appropriate table. The function first creates an ObservableList using the text of the search field to find all Parts that have matched names, even if the name is incomplete. If that list returns nothing, the function tried to match via ID number. It displays on the table matched parts.
      Parameters:
      event - the triggering user event

    • searchByProduct

      public void searchByProduct(javafx.event.Event event)
      This function allows the user to search for a Product and return the found values in the appropriate table. The function first creates an ObservableList using the text of the search field to find all Products that have matched names, even if the name is incomplete. If that list returns nothing, the function tried to match via ID number. It displays on the table matched products.
      Parameters:
      event - the triggering user event

    • addPartButtonAction

      public void addPartButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This function moves to the add part menu.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the button being pressed
      Throws:
      IOException - IOException

    • modifyPartButtonAction

      public void modifyPartButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This function moves to the modify part menu. It calls a function in the controller for the modify part menu to pass data identifying the part to be modified. If the function is requested but no part is selected it displays an alert.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the button being pressed
      Throws:
      IOException - IOException

    • deletePartButtonAction

      public void deletePartButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This function deletes the selected part. Before deletion it uses a confirmation alert to confirm the user activity. Additionally, if no part is deleted, it alerts the user.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the button being pressed

    • addProductButtonAction

      public void addProductButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This function moves to the add product menu.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the button being pressed
      Throws:
      IOException - IOException

    • modifyProductButtonAction

      public void modifyProductButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This function moves to the modify product menu. It calls a function in the controller for the modify product menu to pass data identifying the product to be modified. If the function is requested but no product is selected it displays an alert.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the button being pressed
      Throws:
      IOException - IOException

    • deleteProductButtonAction

      public void deleteProductButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This function deletes the selected product. Before deletion it uses a confirmation alert to confirm the user activity. Additionally, it checks to see if a product has an associated part, and if it does it does not delete hte product. If no product is deleted, it alerts the user.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the button being pressed

    • exitHandler

      public void exitHandler(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      this function close the program when called. The user must confirm the exit.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event
